Description: Two non-joining fragments of lip and wall of North Ionian pottery lotus bowl; interior: dark brown glaze with three added red bands lined in white; tondo reserved with two bands preserved; exterior: top of lip glazed; part of lotus flower and a large dot with a broad band below; inscription cut on exterior, in reserved zone, on lower wall.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 308)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 669, no. 269)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.582)
